org.openremote.java.console.controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openremote.java.console.controller.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main Controller class used for interacting with a controller; the Controller is used to get panel information and to register/unregister panels
    Author:
    Richard Turner

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      void connect(AsyncControllerCallback<ControllerConnectionStatus> callback)
      Connects to this controller and calls the AsyncControllerCallback callback to be called when finished.

      Connects to this controller and calls the AsyncControllerCallback callback to be called when finished.
      void disconnect()
      Disconnect from the controller; this will keep any registered panels but you will no longer receive change notifications, be able to resolve resources and/or send commands

      Set the force load resource data flag; determines if resource data should be automatically fetched when a resource is resolved into a ResourceInfo object.

      Set the timeout for the connection to the controller; default value is 5000.

    • Method Detail

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(int timeout)
        Set the timeout for the connection to the controller; default value is 5000. Useful to change this if link/hardware is slow.
        Parameters:
        timeout -

      • getTimeout

        public int getTimeout()
        Get the current timeout for the connection to the controller

        Returns:

      • getControllerInfo

        public ControllerInfo getControllerInfo()
        Get the ControllerInfo for this controller
        Returns:

      • registerPanel

        public void registerPanel(Panel panel)
        Registers the panel with this controller (it is the caller's responsibility to ensure that the panel belongs to this controller; otherwise callbacks will fail or return unexpected results). Registering means that you will be able to send commands to the controller and you will receive notification of sensor value changes and be able to resolve resources
        Parameters:
        panel -

      • unregisterPanel

        public void unregisterPanel(Panel panel)
        Unregisters the panel from the controller; no more sensor change notifications will be received
        Parameters:
        panel -

      • setLoadResourceData

        public void setLoadResourceData(boolean loadResourceData)
        Set the force load resource data flag; determines if resource data should be automatically fetched when a resource is resolved into a ResourceInfo object. If using caching then this should be false and then ResourceInfo.getModifiedTime() can be compared to the cached resource modified time
        Parameters:
        loadResourceData -

      • getLoadResourceData

        public boolean getLoadResourceData()
        Gets the current for the force load resource data flag
        Returns:

      • setControllerUrl

        public void setControllerUrl(java.net.URL url)
        Set the URL of the controller; will cause a disconnect and re-connect if controller is already connected. Previous connection callback will be called on connection complete
        Parameters:
        url -

      • getControllerUrl

        public java.net.URL getControllerUrl()
        Gets the URL of the controller
        Returns:

      • connect

        public void connect(AsyncControllerCallback<ControllerConnectionStatus> callback,
           int timeout)
        Connects to this controller and calls the AsyncControllerCallback callback to be called when finished. Using the specified timeout for the connection attempt. Any already registered panels will resume monitoring when the connection is re-established.
        Parameters:
        callback -
        timeout -

      • connect

        public void connect(AsyncControllerCallback<ControllerConnectionStatus> callback)
        Connects to this controller and calls the AsyncControllerCallback callback to be called when finished. Using the default controller timeout for the connection attempt. Any already registered panels will resume monitoring when the connection is re-established.
        Parameters:
        callback -

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnect from the controller; this will keep any registered panels but you will no longer receive change notifications, be able to resolve resources and/or send commands

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Indicates if the controller is currently connected
        Returns:
